segment.source: User Account Control Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode (Windows 10)
segment.target: User Account Control Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the User Account Control Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the User Account Control Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode security policy setting.

segment.source: User Account Control: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode
segment.target: User Account Control: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the User Account Control: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the User Account Control: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting determines the behavior of all User Account Control (UAC) policies for the entire system.
segment.target: This policy setting determines the behavior of all User Account Control (UAC) policies for the entire system.

segment.source: This is the setting that turns UAC on or off.
segment.target: This is the setting that turns UAC on or off.

segment.source: Admin Approval Mode and all other UAC policies are dependent on this option being enabled.
segment.target: Admin Approval Mode and all other UAC policies are dependent on this option being enabled.

segment.source: Changing this setting requires restarting the system.
segment.target: Changing this setting requires restarting the system.

segment.source: Admin Approval Mode and all related UAC policies are disabled.
segment.target: Admin Approval Mode and all related UAC policies are disabled.

segment.source: Note: If this security setting is configured to Disabled, the Security Center notifies the user that the overall security of the operating system has been reduced.
segment.target: Note: If this security setting is configured to Disabled, the Security Center notifies the user that the overall security of the operating system has been reduced.

segment.source: Enable this policy to allow all other UAC features and policies to function.
segment.target: Enable this policy to allow all other UAC features and policies to function.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: A restart of the computer is required before this policy will be effective when changes to this policy are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: A restart of the computer is required before this policy will be effective when changes to this policy are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: All auditing capabilities are integrated in Group Policy.
segment.target: All auditing capabilities are integrated in Group Policy.

segment.source: You can configure, deploy, and manage these settings in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or Local Security Policy snap-in for a domain, site, or organizational unit (OU).
segment.target: You can configure, deploy, and manage these settings in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or Local Security Policy snap-in for a domain, site, or organizational unit (OU).

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: This is the setting that turns UAC on or off.
segment.target: This is the setting that turns UAC on or off.

segment.source: If this setting is disabled, UAC is not used, and any security benefits and risk mitigations that are dependent on UAC are not present on the computer.
segment.target: If this setting is disabled, UAC is not used, and any security benefits and risk mitigations that are dependent on UAC are not present on the computer.

segment.source: Enable the User Account Control: Run all users, including administrators, as standard users setting.
segment.target: Enable the User Account Control: Run all users, including administrators, as standard users setting.

segment.source: Users and administrators must learn to work with UAC prompts and adjust their work habits to use least privilege operations.
segment.target: Users and administrators must learn to work with UAC prompts and adjust their work habits to use least privilege operations.
